channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: COVID-19 cases in the PNP top 3,700
item.description: The Philippine National Police on Thursday night logged 82 new COVID-19 infections among its personnel.

item.title: LPA off Isabela now Tropical Depression Julian
item.description: PAGASA said the LPA intensified into a tropical depression at 8 a.m.

item.title: Over 60 groups urge UN rights council to launch probe into 'serious' abuses in Philippines
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: In a letter addressed to the UN body, 62 local and international organizations expressed their “continued grave concern over ongoing extrajudicial executions and other serious human rights violations in the context of the ‘war on drugs’ in the Philippines.”

item.title: Go seeks upgrade of housing programs
item.description: Sen. Bong Go has pushed the passage of bills aimed to enhance and fund national housing programs and provide accessible housing services for the homeless and underprivileged.

item.title: DILG to hire 10,000 contact tracers
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) will hire 10,000 contact tracers for Metro Manila in a move to fight the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Alvarez: Rev gov advocates irresponsible
item.author: Edith Regalado
item.description: Davao del Norte Rep. Pantaleon Alvarez, an ally of President Duterte, said the advocates of a revolutionary government (rev gov) are irresponsible for pushing the initiative as the nation grapples with the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Palace: Robredo P5K aid proposal for poor not feasible
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang yesterday rejected Vice President Leni Robredo’s suggestion that 10 million poor families be given a monthly cash aid of P5,000 each for four months, saying the government does not have enough funds for it.

item.title: Militant lawmakers want full disclosure of Duterte’s health
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Militant lawmakers yesterday joined calls for the public disclosure of President Duterte’s health condition.

item.title: New motorcycle plates out
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Land Transportation Office started the distribution of the first batch of new and bigger motorcycle license plates in Metro Manila yesterday.

item.title: PhilHealth ‘kills’ senior citizen
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Senior citizen Efren Aguilar was shocked to learn that he died four years ago and it was the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth) which apparently “killed” him.
